page.title: 06Transport
page.content: The course of the River Parrett makes its way from Bridgwater past Chilton Trinity village to the sea. Pleasure craft use the river to gain access to the inland port at Bridgwater. It is a tidal river giving an opportunity for salmon fishing by netting in some of the reaches closer to the sea. Ocean_going vessels bring refined oils, animal feeds and organic fertilisers and timber to the wharves at Dunball which has ease of access to the M.5 motorway. Scrap metal is exported to Spain. Sand and gravel boats dredging the Bristol Channel unload at Dunball. Four mobile cranes operate at Dunball Wharf, 307418. The A.38(T) passes through the eastern edge of the area _ a once_infamous bottleneck for holiday travellers.
